page.title: 06ESTON MOOR
page.content: This area is all{scrubland,}heather and bracken. Along the boundry of this area was an old{dry stone wall.}It is quite a flat area.In some parts the land is very{boggy and marshy.}It is quiet on the moors.We noticed that the grass was very springy and looked thinner and lighter than usual.It felt quite slippy too.There were many bushes like{gorse}and{bramble.}Among the heather, there were shallow dips in the ground. This is probably caused by the land subsiding due to the mining which was underneath. In this area there is a pond called{Carr Pond. It was quite muddy but there were some tadpoles in it.The land near to the pond was marshy.
